creditline: Gift of Mrs. Margaret Washburn Hunt and Mr. and Mrs. Louis and June Hunt
markings: on back: seven Mia loan stickers
provenance: Mrs. John (Elisabeth Harding) Washburn Minneapolis (by 1931–until d. 1941); her daughter, Margaret Washburn Hunt, Minneapolis (?1941–d. 1959); by descent to Louis and June Hunt (until 2021; given to Mia)
text:
**Conservation was generously funded by Cynthia S. Larsen.**

Daubigny was an important early supporter of the Impressionists, and this late work suggests the influence of the younger artists. He deployed gestural brushwork and touches of color to make paintings that were often criticized as "impressions" rather than fully realized works.
title: Landscape with Cottage
